nodes.bodyText: I think that we should only set the content-type header if the business method did not set it manually, i.e. after it was executed. If we set it before then multiple content-type headers may be set to the response.

nodes.bodyText: manual-content-type is not a good path for this route. Maybe default-content-type?

Shouldn't we use io.vertx.ext.web.RoutingContext.addHeadersEndHandler(Handler<Void>) instead?
Also from perf POV this means one more Handler instance per each request. It's probably negligible but I wonder if the previous approach "set the content type after the route method is executed" represents some serious issue?
The previous approach would fail if the method used the RoutingContext to send data, as the headers would have already been written.
Ah, you're right! What about the RoutingContext.addHeadersEndHandler()?
